ygData.msgSnippet: Maybe we should only make revive our char by the DNA ... back, because Menasor kept some samples of his DNA. ... that ... The real ... die ... we ve seen ...

Maybe we should only make revive our char by the DNA

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jeepers Creepers" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
> I disagree with that idea, because I intend on bring Skulletron 
back, because Menasor kept some samples of his DNA.
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Tankor 
>   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 12:25 PM
>   Subject: Re: All Read: Important
> 
> 
>   i got an idea once a char is killed they dont come back 
> 
>     Jonathan <jhogan@r...> wrote: 
> 
>     Anyway I was going to rant on about how a sequel wouldn't be all 
that
>     different from a restart but I figured why bother?
> 
>     When I hit the end of my long typed out rant I hit the problem. 
The real
>     one. Another person posted that characters are not allowed to 
die
>     currently...he is utterly incorrect.
> 
>     The problem is the role-playing 101 aspect. People are given the
>     responsibility to judge how much damage they take...however as 
we've seen
>     some can't role-play their way out of a wet paper bag let alone 
responsibly
>     judge how much damage their character takes. When a bot does get 
damaged
>     what typically happens here?
> 
>     Here's the list:
> 
>     1) The enemy bot suddenly becomes cockeyed unable to hit the 
broad side of a
>     barn even if he was a g1 and standing over it.
> 
>     2) The bot never gives chase to his prey. It always lets the 
long time
>     character slip away.
> 
>     3) A short stay (a few hours usually) in the CR chamber and any 
damage is
>     completely gone.
> 
>     4) The character "dies" but faked his death coming back as an 
enemy
>     infiltrator.
> 
>     5) Character "dies" but an evil clone appears which after 
various meeting
>     with colleagues or "loved ones" turns good again. Personality 
reverts to
>     pre-evil clone.
> 
>     6) Character "dies" but is reborn as a more powerful offspring. 
Personality
>     is hardly different.
> 
>     7) Character "dies" but the players 6 other characters cart it's 
blasted
>     carcass back to a lab where they resurrect him.
> 
>     8) Character "dies" replace with new bot same 
personality...eventually
>     people will forget you died and you can go back to your old 
form.
> 
>     Since most will never let their "favorite" character(s) die, I 
mean truly
>     die, never come back like, there's really very little new 
plotlines you can
>     do with them without repeating rehashed already done ones. Take 
for example
>     the geotrons planing to attack the new cat faction....both 
factions will
>     survive, I doubt either player who controls the majority of bots 
in either
>     faction is gonna let their characters get anywhere near killed.
> 
>     And what's to stop this from happening if a restart/sequel DOES 
occur? The
>     role-playing by some will still stink, characters will still be 
incapable of
>     dying and given another year or so all plotlines for THAT game 
will be
>     starting to repeat. While I still do believe a restart/sequel is 
in order I
>     think the role-playing problem needs addressing first to stop a 
repeat of
>     what's happening to NBW.
> 
> 
> 
>     ----- Original Message -----
>     From: "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...>
>     To: <nbwrpg@y...>
>     Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2002 5:57 AM
>     Subject: All Read: Important
> 
> 
>     > My appologies, Narrator, I actually missed your original post.
>     >
>     > I find that Neo Beast Wars has been dragged on for too long, 
and the
>     > world is becoming clogged with bases among other things. Ideas 
are
>     > becoming exausted, if not completely exausted already. It 
seems to
>     > me that we are almost delaying the end of the rpg. If you've 
created
>     > one storyline that you like, is it not fair to say that you 
can
>     > create another better one?
>     >
>     > The idea of creating a sequel to the rpg is one that I would 
agree
>     > with. That would require several things to happen:
>     > 1) Changing the name of the RPG.
>     > 2) Appropriate changes to the website.
>     > 3) A means to store all of everyone's previous characters 
(don't
>     > know about everyone else, but I don't want to lose the bio's 
of all
>     > my characters).
>     > 4) New story (i have an idea, not necessarily for the story, 
but for
>     > how we could create the story).
>     > 5) A catalyst to start us all off (the story should provide 
that).
>     > 6) Implementation of new rules, some of which have been, and 
are
>     > being, discussed in the login messageboard.
>     > 7) other stuff that could be written if I wasn't so tired.
>     >
>     > All in all, since there are more people voting anti-restart 
that I'd
>     > anticpated, I'll ask everyone a perhaps fate deciding 
question:
>     >
>     > Would it be favourable to have a sequel instead of a restart?
>     >
>     >
>     >
>     > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2000@y...> wrote:
>     > > I'm agree with Soulstice, restart isn't good idea. All have 
good
>     > > story-lines and good characters. Perhaps the best would be
>     > eliminate
>     > > less importat characters of our story-line (every rpgers 
could
>     > choice
>     > > at whom wants eliminate) and elimitante factions where are 
member
>     > > that aren't posting and join factions that have few 
characters
>     > > playing.
>     > >
>     > > That other way than restart.
>     > >
>     > >
>     > >
>     > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Narrator" <thecode@p...> wrote:
>     > > > OOC: I at first wasn't sure if I could vote in this one. 
Not
>     > only
>     > > am I seemingly not too much an important part of this RPG, 
despite
>     > > the general current lack of members, and the fact that I've 
been
>     > here
>     > > for getting close to 2 years, but also I am not involved in 
this
>     > > restart. I have very few characters. Characters that, if the 
RPG
>     > is
>     > > restarted, will still be together (Insecticons, 
specifically), and
>     > > therefore it wouldn't harm me to vote yes. However, I don't 
think
>     > I
>     > > could vote yes, because I am apposed to restarting the RPG. 
I have
>     > > decided to vote no. It just doesn't make sense to me to end 
the
>     > saga
>     > > of Neo Beast Wars. It's a great saga that we've worked hard 
over
>     > the
>     > > years to keep going. I don't think that we could suddenly 
pretend
>     > it
>     > > never happened, I think it's impossible. Maybe if we ended 
it and
>     > > started the sequel, I wouldn't mind so much, but otherwise, 
my
>     > vote
>     > > is no. Thank you for reading this if you even did...
>     > >
>     > >
>     > >
>     > > >
>     > > >
